TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ServiceModelSecurityTokenTypes extends System.Object
public ref class ServiceModelSecurityTokenTypes abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Represents the types of security tokens recognized by WCF.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The static strings in this type are used by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.ServiceCredentialsSecurityTokenManager> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.ClientCredentialsSecurityTokenManager> to identify token providers and token authenticators to create based on the token type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AnonymousSslnego As String
public: static property System::String ^ AnonymousSslnego { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates that the initiator is anonymous but the responder certificate is available as part of a SOAP SSL negotiation.
Docs.value: A string that indicates that the initiator is anonymous but the responder certificate is available as part of a SOAP SSL negotiation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property MutualSslnego As String
public: static property System::String ^ MutualSslnego { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates that the initiator and responder mutually authenticate each other using X.509 certificates.
Docs.value: A string that indicates that the initiator and responder mutually authenticate each other using X.509 certificates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The responder's certificate is available from the SOAP SSL negotiation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SecureConversation As String
public: static property System::String ^ SecureConversation { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates whether the service uses WS-SecureConversation authentication.
Docs.value: A string that indicates whether the service uses WS-SecureConversation authentication.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WS-SecureConversation specification is built on the WS-Security and WS-Policy specifications. It provides secure communication between services.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SecurityContext As String
public: static property System::String ^ SecurityContext { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates whether the service uses SOAP SecurityContext authentication.
Docs.value: A string that indicates whether the service uses SOAP SecurityContext authentication.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value indicates that a `SecurityContextToken` is used to represent the security context that secures a conversation between a sender and a recipient.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Spnego As String
public: static property System::String ^ Spnego { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates whether authentication is done via the Windows Services SP Negotiation (SPNEGO) protocol.
Docs.value: A string that indicates whether authentication is done via the Windows Services SPNEGO protocol.

remarks.format: ## Remarks SPNEGO is the native Windows-to-Windows authentication service.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SspiCredential As String
public: static property System::String ^ SspiCredential { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string that indicates whether client authentication is by means of a Windows credential.
Docs.value: A string that indicates whether client authentication is by means of a Windows credential.

remarks.format: ## Remarks SSPI allows an application to use various security models that are available on a computer or network without changing the interface to the security system.
